74#ifdef USE_SIGNALS
75const int dhcpcd_signals[] = {
76 SIGTERM,
77 SIGINT,
78 SIGALRM,
79 SIGHUP,
80 SIGUSR1,
81 SIGUSR2,
82 SIGPIPE
83};
84const size_t dhcpcd_signals_len = __arraycount(dhcpcd_signals);
85#endif

87#define IF_UPANDRUNNING(a) \
88 (((a)->flags & (IFF_UP | IFF_RUNNING)) == (IFF_UP | IFF_RUNNING))
89
90static void
91usage(void)
92{
93
94printf("usage: "PACKAGE"\t[-146ABbDdEGgHJKLMNPpqTV]\n"
95 "\t\t[-C, --nohook hook] [-c, --script script]\n"
96 "\t\t[-e, --env value] [-F, --fqdn FQDN] [-f, --config file]\n"
97 "\t\t[-h, --hostname hostname] [-I, --clientid clientid]\n"
98 "\t\t[-i, --vendorclassid vendorclassid] [-j, --logfile logfile]\n"
99 "\t\t[-l, --leasetime seconds] [-m, --metric metric]\n"
100 "\t\t[-O, --nooption option] [-o, --option option]\n"
101 "\t\t[-Q, --require option] [-r, --request address]\n"
102 "\t\t[-S, --static value]\n"
103 "\t\t[-s, --inform address[/cidr[/broadcast_address]]]\n [--inform6]"
104 "\t\t[-t, --timeout seconds] [-u, --userclass class]\n"
105 "\t\t[-v, --vendor code, value] [-W, --whitelist address[/cidr]] [-w]\n"
106 "\t\t[--waitip [4 | 6]] [-y, --reboot seconds]\n"
107 "\t\t[-X, --blacklist address[/cidr]] [-Z, --denyinterfaces pattern]\n"
108 "\t\t[-z, --allowinterfaces pattern] [--inactive] [interface] [...]\n"
109 " "PACKAGE"\t-n, --rebind [interface]\n"
110 " "PACKAGE"\t-k, --release [interface]\n"
111 " "PACKAGE"\t-U, --dumplease interface\n"
112 " "PACKAGE"\t--version\n"
113 " "PACKAGE"\t-x, --exit [interface]\n");
114}
115
116static void
117free_globals(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
118{
119 struct dhcp_opt *opt;
120
121 if (ctx->ifac) {
122 for (; ctx->ifac > 0; ctx->ifac--)
123 free(ctx->ifav[ctx->ifac - 1]);
124 free(ctx->ifav);
125 ctx->ifav = NULL;
126 }
127 if (ctx->ifdc) {
128 for (; ctx->ifdc > 0; ctx->ifdc--)
129 free(ctx->ifdv[ctx->ifdc - 1]);
130 free(ctx->ifdv);
131 ctx->ifdv = NULL;
132 }
133 if (ctx->ifcc) {
134 for (; ctx->ifcc > 0; ctx->ifcc--)
135 free(ctx->ifcv[ctx->ifcc - 1]);
136 free(ctx->ifcv);
137 ctx->ifcv = NULL;
138 }
139
140#ifdef INET
141 if (ctx->dhcp_opts) {
142 for (opt = ctx->dhcp_opts;
143 ctx->dhcp_opts_len > 0;
144 opt++, ctx->dhcp_opts_len--)
145 free_dhcp_opt_embenc(opt);
146 free(ctx->dhcp_opts);
147 ctx->dhcp_opts = NULL;
148 }
149#endif
150#ifdef INET6
151 if (ctx->nd_opts) {
152 for (opt = ctx->nd_opts;
153 ctx->nd_opts_len > 0;
154 opt++, ctx->nd_opts_len--)
155 free_dhcp_opt_embenc(opt);
156 free(ctx->nd_opts);
157 ctx->nd_opts = NULL;
158 }
159#ifdef DHCP6
160 if (ctx->dhcp6_opts) {
161 for (opt = ctx->dhcp6_opts;
162 ctx->dhcp6_opts_len > 0;
163 opt++, ctx->dhcp6_opts_len--)
164 free_dhcp_opt_embenc(opt);
165 free(ctx->dhcp6_opts);
166 ctx->dhcp6_opts = NULL;
167 }
168#endif
169#endif
170 if (ctx->vivso) {
171 for (opt = ctx->vivso;
172 ctx->vivso_len > 0;
173 opt++, ctx->vivso_len--)
174 free_dhcp_opt_embenc(opt);
175 free(ctx->vivso);
176 ctx->vivso = NULL;
177 }
178}
179
180static void
181handle_exit_timeout(void *arg)
182{
183 struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx;
184
185 ctx = arg;
186 logerrx("timed out");
187 if (!(ctx->options & DHCPCD_MASTER)) {
188 eloop_exit(ctx->eloop, EXIT_FAILURE);
189 return;
190 }
191 ctx->options |= DHCPCD_NOWAITIP;
192 dhcpcd_daemonise(ctx);
193}
194
195static const char *
196dhcpcd_af(int af)
197{
198
199 switch (af) {
200 case AF_UNSPEC:
201 return "IP";
202 case AF_INET:
203 return "IPv4";
204 case AF_INET6:
205 return "IPv6";
206 default:
207 return NULL;
208 }
209}
210
211int
212dhcpcd_ifafwaiting(const struct interface *ifp)
213{
214 unsigned long long opts;
215 bool foundany = false;
216
217 if (ifp->active != IF_ACTIVE_USER)
218 return AF_MAX;
219
220#define DHCPCD_WAITALL (DHCPCD_WAITIP4 | DHCPCD_WAITIP6)
221 opts = ifp->options->options;
222#ifdef INET
223 if (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP4 ||
224 (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP && !(opts & DHCPCD_WAITALL)))
225 {
226 bool foundaddr = ipv4_hasaddr(ifp);
227
228 if (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP4 && !foundaddr)
229 return AF_INET;
230 if (foundaddr)
231 foundany = true;
232 }
233#endif
234#ifdef INET6
235 if (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP6 ||
236 (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP && !(opts & DHCPCD_WAITALL)))
237 {
238 bool foundaddr = ipv6_hasaddr(ifp);
239
240 if (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP6 && !foundaddr)
241 return AF_INET;
242 if (foundaddr)
243 foundany = true;
244 }
245#endif
246
247 if (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP && !(opts & DHCPCD_WAITALL) && !foundany)
248 return AF_UNSPEC;
249 return AF_MAX;
250}
251
252int
253dhcpcd_afwaiting(const struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
254{
255 unsigned long long opts;
256 const struct interface *ifp;
257 int af;
258
259 if (!(ctx->options & DHCPCD_WAITOPTS))
260 return AF_MAX;
261
262 opts = ctx->options;
263 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
264#ifdef INET
265 if (opts & (DHCPCD_WAITIP | DHCPCD_WAITIP4) &&
266 ipv4_hasaddr(ifp))
267 opts &= ~(DHCPCD_WAITIP | DHCPCD_WAITIP4);
268#endif
269#ifdef INET6
270 if (opts & (DHCPCD_WAITIP | DHCPCD_WAITIP6) &&
271 ipv6_hasaddr(ifp))
272 opts &= ~(DHCPCD_WAITIP | DHCPCD_WAITIP6);
273#endif
274 if (!(opts & DHCPCD_WAITOPTS))
275 break;
276 }
277 if (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP)
278 af = AF_UNSPEC;
279 else if (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP4)
280 af = AF_INET;
281 else if (opts & DHCPCD_WAITIP6)
282 af = AF_INET6;
283 else
284 return AF_MAX;
285 return af;
286}
287
288static int
289dhcpcd_ipwaited(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
290{
291 struct interface *ifp;
292 int af;
293
294 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
295 if ((af = dhcpcd_ifafwaiting(ifp)) != AF_MAX) {
296 logdebugx("%s: waiting for an %s address",
297 ifp->name, dhcpcd_af(af));
298 return 0;
299 }
300 }
301
302 if ((af = dhcpcd_afwaiting(ctx)) != AF_MAX) {
303 logdebugx("waiting for an %s address",
304 dhcpcd_af(af));
305 return 0;
306 }
307
308 return 1;
309}
310
311/* Returns the pid of the child, otherwise 0. */
312pid_t
313dhcpcd_daemonise(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
314{
315#ifdef THERE_IS_NO_FORK
316 eloop_timeout_delete(ctx->eloop, handle_exit_timeout, ctx);
317 errno = ENOSYS;
318 return 0;
319#else
320 pid_t pid, lpid;
321 char buf = '\0';
322 int sidpipe[2], fd;
323
324 if (ctx->options & DHCPCD_DAEMONISE &&
325 !(ctx->options & (DHCPCD_DAEMONISED | DHCPCD_NOWAITIP)))
326 {
327 if (!dhcpcd_ipwaited(ctx))
328 return 0;
329 }
330
331 if (ctx->options & DHCPCD_ONESHOT) {
332 loginfox("exiting due to oneshot");
333 eloop_exit(ctx->eloop, EXIT_SUCCESS);
334 return 0;
335 }
336
337 eloop_timeout_delete(ctx->eloop, handle_exit_timeout, ctx);
338 if (ctx->options & DHCPCD_DAEMONISED ||
339 !(ctx->options & DHCPCD_DAEMONISE))
340 return 0;
341 logdebugx("forking to background");
342
343 /* Setup a signal pipe so parent knows when to exit. */
344 if (pipe(sidpipe) == -1) {
345 logerr("%s: pipe", __func__);
346 return 0;
347 }
348
349 switch (pid = fork()) {
350 case -1:
351 logerr("%s: fork", __func__);
352 return 0;
353 case 0:
354 if ((lpid = pidfile_lock(ctx->pidfile)) != 0)
355 logerr("%s: pidfile_lock %d", __func__, lpid);
356 setsid();
357 /* Notify parent it's safe to exit as we've detached. */
358 close(sidpipe[0]);
359 if (write(sidpipe[1], &buf, 1) == -1)
360 logerr("%s: write", __func__);
361 close(sidpipe[1]);
362 /* Some polling methods don't survive after forking,
363 * so ensure we can requeue all our events. */
364 if (eloop_requeue(ctx->eloop) == -1) {
365 logerr("%s: eloop_requeue", __func__);
366 eloop_exit(ctx->eloop, EXIT_FAILURE);
367 }
368 if ((fd = open(_PATH_DEVNULL, O_RDWR, 0)) != -1) {
369 dup2(fd, STDIN_FILENO);
370 dup2(fd, STDOUT_FILENO);
371 dup2(fd, STDERR_FILENO);
372 close(fd);
373 }
374 ctx->options |= DHCPCD_DAEMONISED;
375 return 0;
376 default:
377 /* Wait for child to detach */
378 close(sidpipe[1]);
379 if (read(sidpipe[0], &buf, 1) == -1)
380 logerr("%s: read", __func__);
381 close(sidpipe[0]);
382 loginfox("forked to background, child pid %d", pid);
383 ctx->options |= DHCPCD_FORKED;
384 eloop_exit(ctx->eloop, EXIT_SUCCESS);
385 return pid;
386 }
387#endif
388}
389
390static void
391dhcpcd_drop(struct interface *ifp, int stop)
392{
393
394#ifdef DHCP6
395 dhcp6_drop(ifp, stop ? NULL : "EXPIRE6");
396#endif
397#ifdef INET6
398 ipv6nd_drop(ifp);
399 ipv6_drop(ifp);
400#endif
401#ifdef IPV4LL
402 ipv4ll_drop(ifp);
403#endif
404#ifdef INET
405 dhcp_drop(ifp, stop ? "STOP" : "EXPIRE");
406#endif
407#ifdef ARP
408 arp_drop(ifp);
409#endif
410#if !defined(DHCP6) && !defined(DHCP)
411 UNUSED(stop);
412#endif
413}
414
415static void
416stop_interface(struct interface *ifp)
417{
418 struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx;
419
420 ctx = ifp->ctx;
421 loginfox("%s: removing interface", ifp->name);
422 ifp->options->options |= DHCPCD_STOPPING;
423
424 dhcpcd_drop(ifp, 1);
425 if (ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_DEPARTED)
426 script_runreason(ifp, "DEPARTED");
427 else
428 script_runreason(ifp, "STOPPED");
429
430 /* Delete all timeouts for the interfaces */
431 eloop_q_timeout_delete(ctx->eloop, 0, NULL, ifp);
432
433 /* De-activate the interface */
434 ifp->active = IF_INACTIVE;
435 ifp->options->options &= ~DHCPCD_STOPPING;
436 /* Set the link state to unknown as we're no longer tracking it. */
437 ifp->carrier = LINK_UNKNOWN;
438
439 if (!(ctx->options & (DHCPCD_MASTER | DHCPCD_TEST)))
440 eloop_exit(ctx->eloop, EXIT_FAILURE);
441}
442
443static void
444configure_interface1(struct interface *ifp)
445{
446 struct if_options *ifo = ifp->options;
447
448 /* Do any platform specific configuration */
449 if_conf(ifp);
450
451 /* If we want to release a lease, we can't really persist the
452 * address either. */
453 if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_RELEASE)
454 ifo->options &= ~DHCPCD_PERSISTENT;
455
456 if (ifp->flags & (IFF_POINTOPOINT | IFF_LOOPBACK)) {
457 ifo->options &= ~DHCPCD_ARP;
458 if (!(ifp->flags & IFF_MULTICAST))
459 ifo->options &= ~DHCPCD_IPV6RS;
460 if (!(ifo->options & DHCPCD_INFORM))
461 ifo->options |= DHCPCD_STATIC;
462 }
463 if (ifp->flags & IFF_NOARP ||
464 !(ifo->options & DHCPCD_ARP) ||
465 ifo->options & (DHCPCD_INFORM | DHCPCD_STATIC))
466 ifo->options &= ~DHCPCD_IPV4LL;
467
468 if (ifo->metric != -1)
469 ifp->metric = (unsigned int)ifo->metric;
470
471 if (!(ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV4))
472 ifo->options &= ~(DHCPCD_DHCP | DHCPCD_IPV4LL | DHCPCD_WAITIP4);
473
474#ifdef INET6
475 if (!(ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV6))
476 ifo->options &=
477 ~(DHCPCD_IPV6RS | DHCPCD_DHCP6 | DHCPCD_WAITIP6);
478
479 if (!(ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV6RS))
480 ifo->options &=
481 ~(DHCPCD_IPV6RA_AUTOCONF | DHCPCD_IPV6RA_REQRDNSS);
482
483 /* We want to setup INET6 on the interface as soon as possible. */
484 if (ifp->active == IF_ACTIVE_USER &&
485 ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV6 &&
486 !(ifp->ctx->options & (DHCPCD_DUMPLEASE | DHCPCD_TEST)))
487 {
488 /* If not doing any DHCP, disable the RDNSS requirement. */
489 if (!(ifo->options & (DHCPCD_DHCP | DHCPCD_DHCP6)))
490 ifo->options &= ~DHCPCD_IPV6RA_REQRDNSS;
491 if_setup_inet6(ifp);
492 }
493#endif
494
495 if (!(ifo->options & DHCPCD_IAID)) {
496 /*
497 * An IAID is for identifying a unqiue interface within
498 * the client. It is 4 bytes long. Working out a default
499 * value is problematic.
500 *
501 * Interface name and number are not stable
502 * between different OS's. Some OS's also cannot make
503 * up their mind what the interface should be called
504 * (yes, udev, I'm looking at you).
505 * Also, the name could be longer than 4 bytes.
506 * Also, with pluggable interfaces the name and index
507 * could easily get swapped per actual interface.
508 *
509 * The MAC address is 6 bytes long, the final 3
510 * being unique to the manufacturer and the initial 3
511 * being unique to the organisation which makes it.
512 * We could use the last 4 bytes of the MAC address
513 * as the IAID as it's the most stable part given the
514 * above, but equally it's not guaranteed to be
515 * unique.
516 *
517 * Given the above, and our need to reliably work
518 * between reboots without persitent storage,
519 * generating the IAID from the MAC address is the only
520 * logical default.
521 * Saying that, if a VLANID has been specified then we
522 * can use that. It's possible that different interfaces
523 * can have the same VLANID, but this is no worse than
524 * generating the IAID from the duplicate MAC address.
525 *
526 * dhclient uses the last 4 bytes of the MAC address.
527 * dibbler uses an increamenting counter.
528 * wide-dhcpv6 uses 0 or a configured value.
529 * odhcp6c uses 1.
530 * Windows 7 uses the first 3 bytes of the MAC address
531 * and an unknown byte.
532 * dhcpcd-6.1.0 and earlier used the interface name,
533 * falling back to interface index if name > 4.
534 */
535 if (ifp->vlanid != 0) {
536 uint32_t vlanid;
537
538 /* Maximal VLANID is 4095, so prefix with 0xff
539 * so we don't conflict with an interface index. */
540 vlanid = htonl(ifp->vlanid | 0xff000000);
541 memcpy(ifo->iaid, &vlanid, sizeof(vlanid));
542 } else if (ifp->hwlen >= sizeof(ifo->iaid)) {
543 memcpy(ifo->iaid,
544 ifp->hwaddr + ifp->hwlen - sizeof(ifo->iaid),
545 sizeof(ifo->iaid));
546 } else {
547 uint32_t len;
548
549 len = (uint32_t)strlen(ifp->name);
550 if (len <= sizeof(ifo->iaid)) {
551 memcpy(ifo->iaid, ifp->name, len);
552 if (len < sizeof(ifo->iaid))
553 memset(ifo->iaid + len, 0,
554 sizeof(ifo->iaid) - len);
555 } else {
556 /* IAID is the same size as a uint32_t */
557 len = htonl(ifp->index);
558 memcpy(ifo->iaid, &len, sizeof(ifo->iaid));
559 }
560 }
561 ifo->options |= DHCPCD_IAID;
562 }
563
564#ifdef DHCP6
565 if (ifo->ia_len == 0 && ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV6 &&
566 ifp->name[0] != '\0')
567 {
568 ifo->ia = malloc(sizeof(*ifo->ia));
569 if (ifo->ia == NULL)
570 logerr(__func__);
571 else {
572 ifo->ia_len = 1;
573 ifo->ia->ia_type = D6_OPTION_IA_NA;
574 memcpy(ifo->ia->iaid, ifo->iaid, sizeof(ifo->iaid));
575 memset(&ifo->ia->addr, 0, sizeof(ifo->ia->addr));
576#ifndef SMALL
577 ifo->ia->sla = NULL;
578 ifo->ia->sla_len = 0;
579#endif
580 }
581 } else {
582 size_t i;
583
584 for (i = 0; i < ifo->ia_len; i++) {
585 if (!ifo->ia[i].iaid_set) {
586 memcpy(&ifo->ia[i].iaid, ifo->iaid,
587 sizeof(ifo->ia[i].iaid));
588 ifo->ia[i].iaid_set = 1;
589 }
590 }
591 }
592#endif
593}
594
595int
596dhcpcd_selectprofile(struct interface *ifp, const char *profile)
597{
598 struct if_options *ifo;
599 char pssid[PROFILE_LEN];
600
601 if (ifp->ssid_len) {
602 ssize_t r;
603
604 r = print_string(pssid, sizeof(pssid), OT_ESCSTRING,
605 ifp->ssid, ifp->ssid_len);
606 if (r == -1) {
607 logerr(__func__);
608 pssid[0] = '\0';
609 }
610 } else
611 pssid[0] = '\0';
612 ifo = read_config(ifp->ctx, ifp->name, pssid, profile);
613 if (ifo == NULL) {
614 logdebugx("%s: no profile %s", ifp->name, profile);
615 return -1;
616 }
617 if (profile != NULL) {
618 strlcpy(ifp->profile, profile, sizeof(ifp->profile));
619 loginfox("%s: selected profile %s", ifp->name, profile);
620 } else
621 *ifp->profile = '\0';
622
623 free_options(ifp->ctx, ifp->options);
624 ifp->options = ifo;
625 if (profile) {
626 add_options(ifp->ctx, ifp->name, ifp->options,
627 ifp->ctx->argc, ifp->ctx->argv);
628 configure_interface1(ifp);
629 }
630 return 1;
631}
632
633static void
634configure_interface(struct interface *ifp, int argc, char **argv,
635 unsigned long long options)
636{
637 time_t old;
638
639 old = ifp->options ? ifp->options->mtime : 0;
640 dhcpcd_selectprofile(ifp, NULL);
641 if (ifp->options == NULL) {
642 /* dhcpcd cannot continue with this interface. */
643 ifp->active = IF_INACTIVE;
644 return;
645 }
646 add_options(ifp->ctx, ifp->name, ifp->options, argc, argv);
647 ifp->options->options |= options;
648 configure_interface1(ifp);
649
650 /* If the mtime has changed drop any old lease */
651 if (old != 0 && ifp->options->mtime != old) {
652 logwarnx("%s: confile file changed, expiring leases",
653 ifp->name);
654 dhcpcd_drop(ifp, 0);
655 }
656}
657
658static void
659dhcpcd_initstate2(struct interface *ifp, unsigned long long options)
660{
661 struct if_options *ifo;
662
663 if (options) {
664 if ((ifo = default_config(ifp->ctx)) == NULL) {
665 logerr(__func__);
666 return;
667 }
668 ifo->options |= options;
669 free(ifp->options);
670 ifp->options = ifo;
671 } else
672 ifo = ifp->options;
673
674#ifdef INET6
675 if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV6 && ipv6_init(ifp->ctx) == -1) {
676 logerr(__func__);
677 ifo->options &= ~DHCPCD_IPV6;
678 }
679#endif
680}
681
682static void
683dhcpcd_initstate1(struct interface *ifp, int argc, char **argv,
684 unsigned long long options)
685{
686
687 configure_interface(ifp, argc, argv, options);
688 if (ifp->active)
689 dhcpcd_initstate2(ifp, 0);
690}
691
692static void
693dhcpcd_initstate(struct interface *ifp, unsigned long long options)
694{
695
696 dhcpcd_initstate1(ifp, ifp->ctx->argc, ifp->ctx->argv, options);
697}
698
699void
700dhcpcd_handlecarrier(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, int carrier, unsigned int flags,
701 const char *ifname)
702{
703 struct interface *ifp;
704
705 ifp = if_find(ctx->ifaces, ifname);
706 if (ifp == NULL ||
707 ifp->options == NULL || !(ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_LINK) ||
708 !ifp->active)
709 return;
710
711 if (carrier == LINK_UNKNOWN) {
712 if (ifp->wireless) {
713 carrier = LINK_DOWN;
714 ifp->flags = flags;
715 } else
716 carrier = if_carrier(ifp);
717 } else
718 ifp->flags = flags;
719 if (carrier == LINK_UNKNOWN)
720 carrier = IF_UPANDRUNNING(ifp) ? LINK_UP : LINK_DOWN;
721
722 if (carrier == LINK_DOWN || (ifp->flags & IFF_UP) == 0) {
723 if (ifp->carrier != LINK_DOWN) {
724 if (ifp->carrier == LINK_UP)
725 loginfox("%s: carrier lost", ifp->name);
726#ifdef NOCARRIER_PRESERVE_IP
727 if (ifp->flags & IFF_UP)
728 ifp->carrier = LINK_DOWN_IFFUP;
729 else
730#endif
731 ifp->carrier = LINK_DOWN;
732 script_runreason(ifp, "NOCARRIER");
733#ifdef NOCARRIER_PRESERVE_IP
734 if (ifp->flags & IFF_UP) {
735#ifdef ARP
736 arp_drop(ifp);
737#endif
738#ifdef INET
739 dhcp_abort(ifp);
740#endif
741#ifdef INET6
742 ipv6nd_expire(ifp, 0);
743#endif
744#ifdef DHCP6
745 dhcp6_abort(ifp);
746#endif
747 } else
748#endif
749 dhcpcd_drop(ifp, 0);
750 }
751 } else if (carrier == LINK_UP && ifp->flags & IFF_UP) {
752 if (ifp->carrier != LINK_UP) {
753 loginfox("%s: carrier acquired", ifp->name);
754 ifp->carrier = LINK_UP;
755#if !defined(__linux__) && !defined(__NetBSD__)
756 /* BSD does not emit RTM_NEWADDR or RTM_CHGADDR when the
757 * hardware address changes so we have to go
758 * through the disovery process to work it out. */
759 dhcpcd_handleinterface(ctx, 0, ifp->name);
760#endif
761 if (ifp->wireless) {
762 uint8_t ossid[IF_SSIDLEN];
763 size_t olen;
764
765 olen = ifp->ssid_len;
766 memcpy(ossid, ifp->ssid, ifp->ssid_len);
767 if_getssid(ifp);
768
769 /* If we changed SSID network, drop leases */
770 if (ifp->ssid_len != olen ||
771 memcmp(ifp->ssid, ossid, ifp->ssid_len))
772 {
773#ifdef NOCARRIER_PRESERVE_IP
774 dhcpcd_drop(ifp, 0);
775#endif
776#ifdef IPV4LL
777 ipv4ll_reset(ifp);
778#endif
779 }
780 }
781 dhcpcd_initstate(ifp, 0);
782 script_runreason(ifp, "CARRIER");
783#ifdef INET6
784#ifdef NOCARRIER_PRESERVE_IP
785 /* Set any IPv6 Routers we remembered to expire
786 * faster than they would normally as we
787 * maybe on a new network. */
788 ipv6nd_expire(ifp, RTR_CARRIER_EXPIRE);
789#endif
790 /* RFC4941 Section 3.5 */
791 ipv6_gentempifid(ifp);
792#endif
793 dhcpcd_startinterface(ifp);
794 }
795 }
796}
797
798static void
799warn_iaid_conflict(struct interface *ifp, uint16_t ia_type, uint8_t *iaid)
800{
801 struct interface *ifn;
802#ifdef INET6
803 size_t i;
804 struct if_ia *ia;
805#endif
806
807 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifn, ifp->ctx->ifaces, next) {
808 if (ifn == ifp || !ifn->active)
809 continue;
810 if (ia_type == 0 &&
811 memcmp(ifn->options->iaid, iaid,
812 sizeof(ifn->options->iaid)) == 0)
813 break;
814#ifdef INET6
815 for (i = 0; i < ifn->options->ia_len; i++) {
816 ia = &ifn->options->ia[i];
817 if (ia->ia_type == ia_type &&
818 memcmp(ia->iaid, iaid, sizeof(ia->iaid)) == 0)
819 break;
820 }
821#endif
822 }
823
824 /* This is only a problem if the interfaces are on the same network. */
825 if (ifn)
826 logerrx("%s: IAID conflicts with one assigned to %s",
827 ifp->name, ifn->name);
828}
829
830void
831dhcpcd_startinterface(void *arg)
832{
833 struct interface *ifp = arg;
834 struct if_options *ifo = ifp->options;
835 char buf[DUID_LEN * 3];
836 int carrier;
837
838 if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_LINK) {
839 switch (ifp->carrier) {
840 case LINK_UP:
841 break;
842 case LINK_DOWN:
843 loginfox("%s: waiting for carrier", ifp->name);
844 return;
845 case LINK_UNKNOWN:
846 /* No media state available.
847 * Loop until both IFF_UP and IFF_RUNNING are set */
848 carrier = if_carrier(ifp);
849 if (carrier == LINK_UNKNOWN) {
850 if (IF_UPANDRUNNING(ifp))
851 carrier = LINK_UP;
852 else {
853 struct timespec tv;
854
855 tv.tv_sec = 0;
856 tv.tv_nsec = IF_POLL_UP * NSEC_PER_MSEC;
857 eloop_timeout_add_tv(ifp->ctx->eloop,
858 &tv, dhcpcd_startinterface, ifp);
859 return;
860 }
861 }
862 dhcpcd_handlecarrier(ifp->ctx, carrier,
863 ifp->flags, ifp->name);
864 return;
865 }
866 }
867
868 if (ifo->options & (DHCPCD_DUID | DHCPCD_IPV6)) {
869 /* Report client DUID */
870 if (ifp->ctx->duid == NULL) {
871 if (duid_init(ifp) == 0)
872 return;
873 loginfox("DUID %s",
874 hwaddr_ntoa(ifp->ctx->duid,
875 ifp->ctx->duid_len,
876 buf, sizeof(buf)));
877 }
878 }
879
880 if (ifo->options & (DHCPCD_DUID | DHCPCD_IPV6)) {
881#ifdef INET6
882 size_t i;
883 struct if_ia *ia;
884#endif
885
886 /* Report IAIDs */
887 loginfox("%s: IAID %s", ifp->name,
888 hwaddr_ntoa(ifo->iaid, sizeof(ifo->iaid),
889 buf, sizeof(buf)));
890 warn_iaid_conflict(ifp, 0, ifo->iaid);
891#ifdef INET6
892 for (i = 0; i < ifo->ia_len; i++) {
893 ia = &ifo->ia[i];
894 if (memcmp(ifo->iaid, ia->iaid, sizeof(ifo->iaid))) {
895 loginfox("%s: IA type %u IAID %s",
896 ifp->name, ia->ia_type,
897 hwaddr_ntoa(ia->iaid, sizeof(ia->iaid),
898 buf, sizeof(buf)));
899 warn_iaid_conflict(ifp, ia->ia_type, ia->iaid);
900 }
901 }
902#endif
903 }
904
905#ifdef INET6
906 if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV6 && ipv6_start(ifp) == -1) {
907 logerr("%s: ipv6_start", ifp->name);
908 ifo->options &= ~DHCPCD_IPV6;
909 }
910
911 if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV6) {
912 if (ifp->active == IF_ACTIVE_USER) {
913 ipv6_startstatic(ifp);
914
915 if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV6RS)
916 ipv6nd_startrs(ifp);
917 }
918
919#ifdef DHCP6
920 if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_DHCP6) {
921 dhcp6_find_delegates(ifp);
922
923 if (ifp->active == IF_ACTIVE_USER) {
924 enum DH6S d6_state;
925
926 if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_IA_FORCED)
927 d6_state = DH6S_INIT;
928 else if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_INFORM6)
929 d6_state = DH6S_INFORM;
930 else
931 d6_state = DH6S_CONFIRM;
932 if (dhcp6_start(ifp, d6_state) == -1)
933 logerr("%s: dhcp6_start", ifp->name);
934 }
935 }
936#endif
937 }
938#endif
939
940#ifdef INET
941 if (ifo->options & DHCPCD_IPV4 && ifp->active == IF_ACTIVE_USER) {
942 /* Ensure we have an IPv4 state before starting DHCP */
943 if (ipv4_getstate(ifp) != NULL)
944 dhcp_start(ifp);
945 }
946#endif
947}
948
949static void
950dhcpcd_prestartinterface(void *arg)
951{
952 struct interface *ifp = arg;
953
954 if ((!(ifp->ctx->options & DHCPCD_MASTER) ||
955 ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_IF_UP) &&
956 if_up(ifp) == -1
957#ifdef __sun
958 /* Interface could not yet be plumbed. */
959 && errno != ENXIO
960#endif
961 )
962 logerr("%s: %s", __func__, ifp->name);
963
964 dhcpcd_startinterface(ifp);
965}
966
967static void
968run_preinit(struct interface *ifp)
969{
970
971 if (ifp->ctx->options & DHCPCD_TEST)
972 return;
973
974 script_runreason(ifp, "PREINIT");
975
976 if (ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_LINK && ifp->carrier != LINK_UNKNOWN)
977 script_runreason(ifp,
978 ifp->carrier == LINK_UP ? "CARRIER" : "NOCARRIER");
979}
980
981void
982dhcpcd_activateinterface(struct interface *ifp, unsigned long long options)
983{
984
985 if (!ifp->active) {
986 ifp->active = IF_ACTIVE;
987 dhcpcd_initstate2(ifp, options);
988 /* It's possible we might not have been able to load
989 * a config. */
990 if (ifp->active) {
991 configure_interface1(ifp);
992 run_preinit(ifp);
993 dhcpcd_prestartinterface(ifp);
994 }
995 }
996}
997
998int
999dhcpcd_handleinterface(void *arg, int action, const char *ifname)
1000{
1001 struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx;
1002 struct ifaddrs *ifaddrs;
1003 struct if_head *ifs;
1004 struct interface *ifp, *iff;
1005 const char * const argv[] = { ifname };
1006
1007 ctx = arg;
1008 if (action == -1) {
1009 ifp = if_find(ctx->ifaces, ifname);
1010 if (ifp == NULL) {
1011 errno = ESRCH;
1012 return -1;
1013 }
1014 if (ifp->active) {
1015 logdebugx("%s: interface departed", ifp->name);
1016 ifp->options->options |= DHCPCD_DEPARTED;
1017 stop_interface(ifp);
1018 }
1019 TAILQ_REMOVE(ctx->ifaces, ifp, next);
1020 if_free(ifp);
1021 return 0;
1022 }
1023
1024 ifs = if_discover(ctx, &ifaddrs, -1, UNCONST(argv));
1025 if (ifs == NULL) {
1026 logerr(__func__);
1027 return -1;
1028 }
1029 ifp = if_find(ifs, ifname);
1030 if (ifp == NULL) {
1031 /* This can happen if an interface is quickly added
1032 * and then removed. */
1033 errno = ENOENT;
1034 return -1;
1035 }
1036 /* Check if we already have the interface */
1037 iff = if_find(ctx->ifaces, ifp->name);
1038
1039 if (iff != NULL) {
1040 if (iff->active)
1041 logdebugx("%s: interface updated", iff->name);
1042 /* The flags and hwaddr could have changed */
1043 iff->flags = ifp->flags;
1044 iff->hwlen = ifp->hwlen;
1045 if (ifp->hwlen != 0)
1046 memcpy(iff->hwaddr, ifp->hwaddr, iff->hwlen);
1047 } else {
1048 TAILQ_REMOVE(ifs, ifp, next);
1049 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(ctx->ifaces, ifp, next);
1050 if (ifp->active) {
1051 logdebugx("%s: interface added", ifp->name);
1052 dhcpcd_initstate(ifp, 0);
1053 run_preinit(ifp);
1054 }
1055 iff = ifp;
1056 }
1057
1058 if (action > 0) {
1059 if_learnaddrs(ctx, ifs, &ifaddrs);
1060 if (iff->active)
1061 dhcpcd_prestartinterface(iff);
1062 }
1063
1064 /* Free our discovered list */
1065 while ((ifp = TAILQ_FIRST(ifs))) {
1066 TAILQ_REMOVE(ifs, ifp, next);
1067 if_free(ifp);
1068 }
1069 free(ifs);
1070
1071 return 1;
1072}
1073
1074static void
1075dhcpcd_handlelink(void *arg)
1076{
1077 struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx = arg;
1078
1079 if (if_handlelink(ctx) == -1) {
1080 if (errno == ENOBUFS || errno == ENOMEM) {
1081 dhcpcd_linkoverflow(ctx);
1082 return;
1083 }
1084 logerr(__func__);
1085 }
1086}
1087
1088static void
1089dhcpcd_checkcarrier(void *arg)
1090{
1091 struct interface *ifp = arg;
1092
1093 dhcpcd_handlecarrier(ifp->ctx, LINK_UNKNOWN, ifp->flags, ifp->name);
1094}
1095
1096void
1097dhcpcd_linkoverflow(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
1098{
1099 struct if_head *ifaces;
1100 struct ifaddrs *ifaddrs;
1101 struct interface *ifp, *ifn, *ifp1;
1102
1103 logerrx("route socket overflowed - learning interface state");
1104
1105 /* Close the existing socket and open a new one.
1106 * This is easier than draining the kernel buffer of an
1107 * in-determinate size. */
1108 eloop_event_delete(ctx->eloop, ctx->link_fd);
1109 close(ctx->link_fd);
1110 if_closesockets_os(ctx);
1111 if (if_opensockets_os(ctx) == -1) {
1112 logerr("%s: if_opensockets", __func__);
1113 eloop_exit(ctx->eloop, EXIT_FAILURE);
1114 return;
1115 }
1116 eloop_event_add(ctx->eloop, ctx->link_fd, dhcpcd_handlelink, ctx);
1117
1118 /* Work out the current interfaces. */
1119 ifaces = if_discover(ctx, &ifaddrs, ctx->ifc, ctx->ifv);
1120
1121 /* Punt departed interfaces */
1122 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next, ifn) {
1123 if (if_find(ifaces, ifp->name) != NULL)
1124 continue;
1125 dhcpcd_handleinterface(ctx, -1, ifp->name);
1126 }
1127
1128 /* Add new interfaces */
1129 TAILQ_FOREACH_SAFE(ifp, ifaces, next, ifn) {
1130 ifp1 = if_find(ctx->ifaces, ifp->name);
1131 if (ifp1 != NULL) {
1132 /* If the interface already exists,
1133 * check carrier state. */
1134 eloop_timeout_add_sec(ctx->eloop, 0,
1135 dhcpcd_checkcarrier, ifp1);
1136 continue;
1137 }
1138 TAILQ_REMOVE(ifaces, ifp, next);
1139 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(ctx->ifaces, ifp, next);
1140 if (ifp->active)
1141 eloop_timeout_add_sec(ctx->eloop, 0,
1142 dhcpcd_prestartinterface, ifp);
1143 }
1144
1145 /* Update address state. */
1146 if_markaddrsstale(ctx->ifaces);
1147 if_learnaddrs(ctx, ctx->ifaces, &ifaddrs);
1148 if_deletestaleaddrs(ctx->ifaces);
1149}
1150
1151void
1152dhcpcd_handlehwaddr(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, const char *ifname,
1153 const void *hwaddr, uint8_t hwlen)
1154{
1155 struct interface *ifp;
1156 char buf[sizeof(ifp->hwaddr) * 3];
1157
1158 ifp = if_find(ctx->ifaces, ifname);
1159 if (ifp == NULL)
1160 return;
1161
1162 if (!if_valid_hwaddr(hwaddr, hwlen))
1163 hwlen = 0;
1164
1165 if (hwlen > sizeof(ifp->hwaddr)) {
1166 errno = ENOBUFS;
1167 logerr("%s: %s", __func__, ifp->name);
1168 return;
1169 }
1170
1171 if (ifp->hwlen == hwlen && memcmp(ifp->hwaddr, hwaddr, hwlen) == 0)
1172 return;
1173
1174 loginfox("%s: new hardware address: %s", ifp->name,
1175 hwaddr_ntoa(hwaddr, hwlen, buf, sizeof(buf)));
1176 ifp->hwlen = hwlen;
1177 memcpy(ifp->hwaddr, hwaddr, hwlen);
1178}
1179
1180static void
1181if_reboot(struct interface *ifp, int argc, char **argv)
1182{
1183 unsigned long long oldopts;
1184
1185 oldopts = ifp->options->options;
1186 script_runreason(ifp, "RECONFIGURE");
1187 dhcpcd_initstate1(ifp, argc, argv, 0);
1188#ifdef INET
1189 dhcp_reboot_newopts(ifp, oldopts);
1190#endif
1191#ifdef DHCP6
1192 dhcp6_reboot(ifp);
1193#endif
1194 dhcpcd_prestartinterface(ifp);
1195}
1196
1197static void
1198reload_config(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
1199{
1200 struct if_options *ifo;
1201
1202 free_globals(ctx);
1203 if ((ifo = read_config(ctx, NULL, NULL, NULL)) == NULL)
1204 return;
1205 add_options(ctx, NULL, ifo, ctx->argc, ctx->argv);
1206 /* We need to preserve these two options. */
1207 if (ctx->options & DHCPCD_MASTER)
1208 ifo->options |= DHCPCD_MASTER;
1209 if (ctx->options & DHCPCD_DAEMONISED)
1210 ifo->options |= DHCPCD_DAEMONISED;
1211 ctx->options = ifo->options;
1212 free_options(ctx, ifo);
1213}
1214
1215static void
1216reconf_reboot(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, int action, int argc, char **argv, int oi)
1217{
1218 int i;
1219 struct interface *ifp;
1220
1221 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
1222 for (i = oi; i < argc; i++) {
1223 if (strcmp(ifp->name, argv[i]) == 0)
1224 break;
1225 }
1226 if (oi != argc && i == argc)
1227 continue;
1228 if (ifp->active == IF_ACTIVE_USER) {
1229 if (action)
1230 if_reboot(ifp, argc, argv);
1231#ifdef INET
1232 else
1233 ipv4_applyaddr(ifp);
1234#endif
1235 } else if (i != argc) {
1236 ifp->active = IF_ACTIVE_USER;
1237 dhcpcd_initstate1(ifp, argc, argv, 0);
1238 run_preinit(ifp);
1239 dhcpcd_prestartinterface(ifp);
1240 }
1241 }
1242}
1243
1244static void
1245stop_all_interfaces(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, unsigned long long opts)
1246{
1247 struct interface *ifp;
1248
1249 ctx->options |= DHCPCD_EXITING;
1250 /* Drop the last interface first */
1251 TAILQ_FOREACH_REVERSE(ifp, ctx->ifaces, if_head, next) {
1252 if (ifp->active) {
1253 ifp->options->options |= opts;
1254 if (ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_RELEASE)
1255 ifp->options->options &= ~DHCPCD_PERSISTENT;
1256 ifp->options->options |= DHCPCD_EXITING;
1257 stop_interface(ifp);
1258 }
1259 }
1260}
1261
1262static void
1263dhcpcd_ifrenew(struct interface *ifp)
1264{
1265
1266 if (!ifp->active)
1267 return;
1268
1269 if (ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_LINK &&
1270 ifp->carrier == LINK_DOWN)
1271 return;
1272
1273#ifdef INET
1274 dhcp_renew(ifp);
1275#endif
1276#ifdef INET6
1277#define DHCPCD_RARENEW (DHCPCD_IPV6 | DHCPCD_IPV6RS)
1278 if ((ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_RARENEW) == DHCPCD_RARENEW)
1279 ipv6nd_startrs(ifp);
1280#endif
1281#ifdef DHCP6
1282 dhcp6_renew(ifp);
1283#endif
1284}
1285
1286static void
1287dhcpcd_renew(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx)
1288{
1289 struct interface *ifp;
1290
1291 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx->ifaces, next) {
1292 dhcpcd_ifrenew(ifp);
1293 }
1294}
1295
1296#ifdef USE_SIGNALS
1297#define sigmsg "received %s, %s"
1298static void
1299signal_cb(int sig, void *arg)
1300{
1301 struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx = arg;
1302 unsigned long long opts;
1303 int exit_code;
1304
1305 opts = 0;
1306 exit_code = EXIT_FAILURE;
1307 switch (sig) {
1308 case SIGINT:
1309 loginfox(sigmsg, "SIGINT", "stopping");
1310 break;
1311 case SIGTERM:
1312 loginfox(sigmsg, "SIGTERM", "stopping");
1313 exit_code = EXIT_SUCCESS;
1314 break;
1315 case SIGALRM:
1316 loginfox(sigmsg, "SIGALRM", "releasing");
1317 opts |= DHCPCD_RELEASE;
1318 exit_code = EXIT_SUCCESS;
1319 break;
1320 case SIGHUP:
1321 loginfox(sigmsg, "SIGHUP", "rebinding");
1322 reload_config(ctx);
1323 /* Preserve any options passed on the commandline
1324 * when we were started. */
1325 reconf_reboot(ctx, 1, ctx->argc, ctx->argv,
1326 ctx->argc - ctx->ifc);
1327 return;
1328 case SIGUSR1:
1329 loginfox(sigmsg, "SIGUSR1", "renewing");
1330 dhcpcd_renew(ctx);
1331 return;
1332 case SIGUSR2:
1333 loginfox(sigmsg, "SIGUSR2", "reopening log");
1334 logclose();
1335 if (logopen(ctx->logfile) == -1)
1336 logerr(__func__);
1337 return;
1338 case SIGPIPE:
1339 logwarnx("received SIGPIPE");
1340 return;
1341 default:
1342 logerrx("received signal %d but don't know what to do with it",
1343 sig);
1344 return;
1345 }
1346
1347 if (!(ctx->options & DHCPCD_TEST))
1348 stop_all_interfaces(ctx, opts);
1349 eloop_exit(ctx->eloop, exit_code);
1350}
1351#endif
1352
1353static void
1354dhcpcd_getinterfaces(void *arg)
1355{
1356 struct fd_list *fd = arg;
1357 struct interface *ifp;
1358 size_t len;
1359
1360 len = 0;
1361 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, fd->ctx->ifaces, next) {
1362 if (!ifp->active)
1363 continue;
1364 len++;
1365#ifdef INET
1366 if (D_STATE_RUNNING(ifp))
1367 len++;
1368#endif
1369#ifdef IPV4LL
1370 if (IPV4LL_STATE_RUNNING(ifp))
1371 len++;
1372#endif
1373#ifdef INET6
1374 if (IPV6_STATE_RUNNING(ifp))
1375 len++;
1376 if (RS_STATE_RUNNING(ifp))
1377 len++;
1378#endif
1379#ifdef DHCP6
1380 if (D6_STATE_RUNNING(ifp))
1381 len++;
1382#endif
1383 }
1384 if (write(fd->fd, &len, sizeof(len)) != sizeof(len))
1385 return;
1386 eloop_event_remove_writecb(fd->ctx->eloop, fd->fd);
1387 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, fd->ctx->ifaces, next) {
1388 if (!ifp->active)
1389 continue;
1390 if (send_interface(fd, ifp) == -1)
1391 logerr(__func__);
1392 }
1393}
1394
1395int
1396dhcpcd_handleargs(struct dhcpcd_ctx *ctx, struct fd_list *fd,
1397 int argc, char **argv)
1398{
1399 struct interface *ifp;
1400 unsigned long long opts;
1401 int opt, oi, do_reboot, do_renew;
1402 size_t len, l;
1403 char *tmp, *p;
1404
1405 /* Special commands for our control socket
1406 * as the other end should be blocking until it gets the
1407 * expected reply we should be safely able just to change the
1408 * write callback on the fd */
1409 if (strcmp(*argv, "--version") == 0) {
1410 return control_queue(fd, UNCONST(VERSION),
1411 strlen(VERSION) + 1, 0);
1412 } else if (strcmp(*argv, "--getconfigfile") == 0) {
1413 return control_queue(fd, UNCONST(fd->ctx->cffile),
1414 strlen(fd->ctx->cffile) + 1, 0);
1415 } else if (strcmp(*argv, "--getinterfaces") == 0) {
1416 eloop_event_add_w(fd->ctx->eloop, fd->fd,
1417 dhcpcd_getinterfaces, fd);
1418 return 0;
1419 } else if (strcmp(*argv, "--listen") == 0) {
1420 fd->flags |= FD_LISTEN;
1421 return 0;
1422 }
1423
1424 /* Only priviledged users can control dhcpcd via the socket. */
1425 if (fd->flags & FD_UNPRIV) {
1426 errno = EPERM;
1427 return -1;
1428 }
1429
1430 /* Log the command */
1431 len = 1;
1432 for (opt = 0; opt < argc; opt++)
1433 len += strlen(argv[opt]) + 1;
1434 tmp = malloc(len);
1435 if (tmp == NULL)
1436 return -1;
1437 p = tmp;
1438 for (opt = 0; opt < argc; opt++) {
1439 l = strlen(argv[opt]);
1440 strlcpy(p, argv[opt], len);
1441 len -= l + 1;
1442 p += l;
1443 *p++ = ' ';
1444 }
1445 *--p = '\0';
1446 loginfox("control command: %s", tmp);
1447 free(tmp);
1448
1449 optind = 0;
1450 oi = 0;
1451 opts = 0;
1452 do_reboot = do_renew = 0;
1453 while ((opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, IF_OPTS, cf_options, &oi)) != -1)
1454 {
1455 switch (opt) {
1456 case 'g':
1457 /* Assumed if below not set */
1458 break;
1459 case 'k':
1460 opts |= DHCPCD_RELEASE;
1461 break;
1462 case 'n':
1463 do_reboot = 1;
1464 break;
1465 case 'p':
1466 opts |= DHCPCD_PERSISTENT;
1467 break;
1468 case 'x':
1469 opts |= DHCPCD_EXITING;
1470 break;
1471 case 'N':
1472 do_renew = 1;
1473 break;
1474 }
1475 }
1476
1477 if (opts & (DHCPCD_EXITING | DHCPCD_RELEASE)) {
1478 if (optind == argc) {
1479 stop_all_interfaces(ctx, opts);
1480 eloop_exit(ctx->eloop, EXIT_SUCCESS);
1481 return 0;
1482 }
1483 for (oi = optind; oi < argc; oi++) {
1484 if ((ifp = if_find(ctx->ifaces, argv[oi])) == NULL)
1485 continue;
1486 if (!ifp->active)
1487 continue;
1488 ifp->options->options |= opts;
1489 if (opts & DHCPCD_RELEASE)
1490 ifp->options->options &= ~DHCPCD_PERSISTENT;
1491 stop_interface(ifp);
1492 }
1493 return 0;
1494 }
1495
1496 if (do_renew) {
1497 if (optind == argc) {
1498 dhcpcd_renew(ctx);
1499 return 0;
1500 }
1501 for (oi = optind; oi < argc; oi++) {
1502 if ((ifp = if_find(ctx->ifaces, argv[oi])) == NULL)
1503 continue;
1504 dhcpcd_ifrenew(ifp);
1505 }
1506 return 0;
1507 }
1508
1509 reload_config(ctx);
1510 /* XXX: Respect initial commandline options? */
1511 reconf_reboot(ctx, do_reboot, argc, argv, optind - 1);
1512 return 0;
1513}
1514
1515int
1516main(int argc, char **argv)
1517{
1518 struct dhcpcd_ctx ctx;
1519 struct ifaddrs *ifaddrs = NULL;
1520 struct if_options *ifo;
1521 struct interface *ifp;
1522 uint16_t family = 0;
1523 int opt, oi = 0, i;
1524 unsigned int logopts;
1525 time_t t;
1526 ssize_t len;
1527#if defined(USE_SIGNALS) || !defined(THERE_IS_NO_FORK)
1528 pid_t pid;
1529#endif
1530#ifdef USE_SIGNALS
1531 int sig = 0;
1532 const char *siga = NULL;
1533#endif
1534
1535 /* Test for --help and --version */
1536 if (argc > 1) {
1537 if (strcmp(argv[1], "--help") == 0) {
1538 usage();
1539 return EXIT_SUCCESS;
1540 } else if (strcmp(argv[1], "--version") == 0) {
1541 printf(""PACKAGE" "VERSION"\n%s\n", dhcpcd_copyright);
1542 printf("Compiled in features:"
1543#ifdef INET
1544 " INET"
1545#endif
1546#ifdef ARP
1547 " ARP"
1548#endif
1549#ifdef ARPING
1550 " ARPing"
1551#endif
1552#ifdef IPV4LL
1553 " IPv4LL"
1554#endif
1555#ifdef INET6
1556 " INET6"
1557#endif
1558#ifdef DHCP6
1559 " DHCPv6"
1560#endif
1561#ifdef AUTH
1562 " AUTH"
1563#endif
1564 "\n");
1565 return EXIT_SUCCESS;
1566 }
1567 }
1568
1569 memset(&ctx, 0, sizeof(ctx));
1570
1571 ifo = NULL;
1572 ctx.cffile = CONFIG;
1573 ctx.control_fd = ctx.control_unpriv_fd = ctx.link_fd = -1;
1574 ctx.pf_inet_fd = -1;
1575
1576 TAILQ_INIT(&ctx.control_fds);
1577#ifdef PLUGIN_DEV
1578 ctx.dev_fd = -1;
1579#endif
1580#ifdef INET
1581 ctx.udp_fd = -1;
1582#endif
1583 rt_init(&ctx);
1584
1585 logopts = LOGERR_ERR|LOGERR_LOG|LOGERR_LOG_DATE|LOGERR_LOG_PID;
1586 i = 0;
1587 while ((opt = getopt_long(argc, argv,
1588 ctx.options & DHCPCD_PRINT_PIDFILE ? NOERR_IF_OPTS : IF_OPTS,
1589 cf_options, &oi)) != -1)
1590 {
1591 switch (opt) {
1592 case '4':
1593 family = AF_INET;
1594 break;
1595 case '6':
1596 family = AF_INET6;
1597 break;
1598 case 'f':
1599 ctx.cffile = optarg;
1600 break;
1601 case 'j':
1602 free(ctx.logfile);
1603 ctx.logfile = strdup(optarg);
1604 break;
1605#ifdef USE_SIGNALS
1606 case 'k':
1607 sig = SIGALRM;
1608 siga = "ALRM";
1609 break;
1610 case 'n':
1611 sig = SIGHUP;
1612 siga = "HUP";
1613 break;
1614 case 'g':
1615 case 'p':
1616 /* Force going via command socket as we're
1617 * out of user definable signals. */
1618 i = 4;
1619 break;
1620 case 'q':
1621 logopts |= LOGERR_QUIET;
1622 break;
1623 case 'x':
1624 sig = SIGTERM;
1625 siga = "TERM";
1626 break;
1627 case 'N':
1628 sig = SIGUSR1;
1629 siga = "USR1";
1630 break;
1631#endif
1632 case 'P':
1633 ctx.options |= DHCPCD_PRINT_PIDFILE;
1634 logopts &= ~(LOGERR_LOG | LOGERR_ERR);
1635 break;
1636 case 'T':
1637 i = 1;
1638 logopts &= ~LOGERR_LOG;
1639 break;
1640 case 'U':
1641 i = 3;
1642 break;
1643 case 'V':
1644 i = 2;
1645 break;
1646 case '?':
1647 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_PRINT_PIDFILE)
1648 continue;
1649 usage();
1650 goto exit_failure;
1651 }
1652 }
1653
1654 logsetopts(logopts);
1655 logopen(ctx.logfile);
1656
1657 ctx.argv = argv;
1658 ctx.argc = argc;
1659 ctx.ifc = argc - optind;
1660 ctx.ifv = argv + optind;
1661
1662 ifo = read_config(&ctx, NULL, NULL, NULL);
1663 if (ifo == NULL) {
1664 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_PRINT_PIDFILE)
1665 goto printpidfile;
1666 goto exit_failure;
1667 }
1668 opt = add_options(&ctx, NULL, ifo, argc, argv);
1669 if (opt != 1) {
1670 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_PRINT_PIDFILE)
1671 goto printpidfile;
1672 if (opt == 0)
1673 usage();
1674 goto exit_failure;
1675 }
1676 if (i == 2) {
1677 printf("Interface options:\n");
1678 if (optind == argc - 1) {
1679 free_options(&ctx, ifo);
1680 ifo = read_config(&ctx, argv[optind], NULL, NULL);
1681 if (ifo == NULL)
1682 goto exit_failure;
1683 add_options(&ctx, NULL, ifo, argc, argv);
1684 }
1685 if_printoptions();
1686#ifdef INET
1687 if (family == 0 || family == AF_INET) {
1688 printf("\nDHCPv4 options:\n");
1689 dhcp_printoptions(&ctx,
1690 ifo->dhcp_override, ifo->dhcp_override_len);
1691 }
1692#endif
1693#ifdef INET6
1694 if (family == 0 || family == AF_INET6) {
1695 printf("\nND options:\n");
1696 ipv6nd_printoptions(&ctx,
1697 ifo->nd_override, ifo->nd_override_len);
1698#ifdef DHCP6
1699 printf("\nDHCPv6 options:\n");
1700 dhcp6_printoptions(&ctx,
1701 ifo->dhcp6_override, ifo->dhcp6_override_len);
1702#endif
1703 }
1704#endif
1705 goto exit_success;
1706 }
1707 ctx.options |= ifo->options;
1708 if (i == 1 || i == 3) {
1709 if (i == 1)
1710 ctx.options |= DHCPCD_TEST;
1711 else
1712 ctx.options |= DHCPCD_DUMPLEASE;
1713 ctx.options |= DHCPCD_PERSISTENT;
1714 ctx.options &= ~DHCPCD_DAEMONISE;
1715 }
1716
1717#ifdef THERE_IS_NO_FORK
1718 ctx.options &= ~DHCPCD_DAEMONISE;
1719#endif
1720
1721 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_DEBUG)
1722 logsetopts(logopts | LOGERR_DEBUG);
1723
1724 if (!(ctx.options & (DHCPCD_TEST | DHCPCD_DUMPLEASE))) {
1725printpidfile:
1726 /* If we have any other args, we should run as a single dhcpcd
1727 * instance for that interface. */
1728 if (optind == argc - 1 && !(ctx.options & DHCPCD_MASTER)) {
1729 const char *per;
1730 const char *ifname;
1731
1732 ifname = *ctx.ifv;
1733 if (ifname == NULL || strlen(ifname) > IF_NAMESIZE) {
1734 errno = ifname == NULL ? EINVAL : E2BIG;
1735 logerr("%s: ", ifname);
1736 goto exit_failure;
1737 }
1738 /* Allow a dhcpcd interface per address family */
1739 switch(family) {
1740 case AF_INET:
1741 per = "-4";
1742 break;
1743 case AF_INET6:
1744 per = "-6";
1745 break;
1746 default:
1747 per = "";
1748 }
1749 snprintf(ctx.pidfile, sizeof(ctx.pidfile),
1750 PIDFILE, "-", ifname, per);
1751 } else {
1752 snprintf(ctx.pidfile, sizeof(ctx.pidfile),
1753 PIDFILE, "", "", "");
1754 ctx.options |= DHCPCD_MASTER;
1755 }
1756 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_PRINT_PIDFILE) {
1757 printf("%s\n", ctx.pidfile);
1758 goto exit_success;
1759 }
1760 }
1761
1762 if (chdir("/") == -1)
1763 logerr("%s: chdir `/'", __func__);
1764
1765 /* Freeing allocated addresses from dumping leases can trigger
1766 * eloop removals as well, so init here. */
1767 if ((ctx.eloop = eloop_new()) == NULL) {
1768 logerr("%s: eloop_init", __func__);
1769 goto exit_failure;
1770 }
1771#ifdef USE_SIGNALS
1772 /* Save signal mask, block and redirect signals to our handler */
1773 if (eloop_signal_set_cb(ctx.eloop,
1774 dhcpcd_signals, dhcpcd_signals_len,
1775 signal_cb, &ctx) == -1)
1776 {
1777 logerr("%s: eloop_signal_set_cb", __func__);
1778 goto exit_failure;
1779 }
1780 if (eloop_signal_mask(ctx.eloop, &ctx.sigset) == -1) {
1781 logerr("%s: eloop_signal_mask", __func__);
1782 goto exit_failure;
1783 }
1784#endif
1785
1786 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_DUMPLEASE) {
1787 /* Open sockets so we can dump something about
1788 * valid interfaces. */
1789 if (if_opensockets(&ctx) == -1) {
1790 logerr("%s: if_opensockets", __func__);
1791 goto exit_failure;
1792 }
1793 if (optind != argc) {
1794 /* We need to try and find the interface so we can load
1795 * the hardware address to compare automated IAID */
1796 ctx.ifaces = if_discover(&ctx, &ifaddrs,
1797 argc - optind, argv + optind);
1798 } else {
1799 if ((ctx.ifaces = malloc(sizeof(*ctx.ifaces))) != NULL)
1800 TAILQ_INIT(ctx.ifaces);
1801 }
1802 if (ctx.ifaces == NULL) {
1803 logerr("%s: if_discover", __func__);
1804 goto exit_failure;
1805 }
1806 ifp = if_find(ctx.ifaces, argv[optind]);
1807 if (ifp == NULL) {
1808 ifp = calloc(1, sizeof(*ifp));
1809 if (ifp == NULL) {
1810 logerr(__func__);
1811 goto exit_failure;
1812 }
1813 if (optind != argc)
1814 strlcpy(ctx.pidfile, argv[optind],
1815 sizeof(ctx.pidfile));
1816 ifp->ctx = &ctx;
1817 TAILQ_INSERT_HEAD(ctx.ifaces, ifp, next);
1818 if (family == 0) {
1819 if (ctx.pidfile[0] != '\0' &&
1820 ctx.pidfile[strlen(ctx.pidfile) - 1] == '6')
1821 family = AF_INET6;
1822 else
1823 family = AF_INET;
1824 }
1825 }
1826 configure_interface(ifp, ctx.argc, ctx.argv, 0);
1827 i = 0;
1828 if (family == 0 || family == AF_INET) {
1829#ifdef INET
1830 if (dhcp_dump(ifp) == -1)
1831 i = -1;
1832#else
1833 if (family == AF_INET)
1834 logerrx("No INET support");
1835#endif
1836 }
1837 if (family == 0 || family == AF_INET6) {
1838#ifdef DHCP6
1839 if (dhcp6_dump(ifp) == -1)
1840 i = -1;
1841#else
1842 if (family == AF_INET6)
1843 logerrx("No DHCP6 support");
1844#endif
1845 }
1846 if (i == -1)
1847 goto exit_failure;
1848 goto exit_success;
1849 }
1850
1851#ifdef USE_SIGNALS
1852 /* Test against siga instead of sig to avoid gcc
1853 * warning about a bogus potential signed overflow.
1854 * The end result will be the same. */
1855 if ((siga == NULL || i == 4 || ctx.ifc != 0) &&
1856 !(ctx.options & DHCPCD_TEST))
1857 {
1858#endif
1859 if (!(ctx.options & DHCPCD_MASTER))
1860 ctx.control_fd = control_open(argv[optind]);
1861 if (ctx.control_fd == -1)
1862 ctx.control_fd = control_open(NULL);
1863 if (ctx.control_fd != -1) {
1864 loginfox("sending commands to master dhcpcd process");
1865 len = control_send(&ctx, argc, argv);
1866 control_close(&ctx);
1867 if (len > 0) {
1868 logdebugx("send OK");
1869 goto exit_success;
1870 } else {
1871 logerr("%s: control_send", __func__);
1872 goto exit_failure;
1873 }
1874 } else {
1875 if (errno != ENOENT)
1876 logerr("%s: control_open", __func__);
1877 }
1878#ifdef USE_SIGNALS
1879 }
1880#endif
1881
1882#ifdef USE_SIGNALS
1883 if (sig != 0) {
1884 pid = pidfile_read(ctx.pidfile);
1885 if (pid != 0 && pid != -1)
1886 loginfox("sending signal %s to pid %d", siga, pid);
1887 if (pid == 0 || pid == -1 || kill(pid, sig) != 0) {
1888 if (sig != SIGHUP && sig != SIGUSR1 && errno != EPERM)
1889 logerrx(PACKAGE" not running");
1890 if (pid != 0 && pid != -1 && errno != ESRCH) {
1891 logerr("kill");
1892 goto exit_failure;
1893 }
1894 unlink(ctx.pidfile);
1895 if (sig != SIGHUP && sig != SIGUSR1)
1896 goto exit_failure;
1897 } else {
1898 struct timespec ts;
1899
1900 if (sig == SIGHUP || sig == SIGUSR1)
1901 goto exit_success;
1902 /* Spin until it exits */
1903 loginfox("waiting for pid %d to exit", pid);
1904 ts.tv_sec = 0;
1905 ts.tv_nsec = 100000000; /* 10th of a second */
1906 for(i = 0; i < 100; i++) {
1907 nanosleep(&ts, NULL);
1908 if (pidfile_read(ctx.pidfile) == -1)
1909 goto exit_success;
1910 }
1911 logerrx("pid %d failed to exit", pid);
1912 goto exit_failure;
1913 }
1914 }
1915
1916 if (!(ctx.options & DHCPCD_TEST)) {
1917 /* Ensure we have the needed directories */
1918 if (mkdir(RUNDIR, 0755) == -1 && errno != EEXIST)
1919 logerr("%s: mkdir `%s'", __func__, RUNDIR);
1920 if (mkdir(DBDIR, 0755) == -1 && errno != EEXIST)
1921 logerr("%s: mkdir `%s'", __func__, DBDIR);
1922
1923 if ((pid = pidfile_lock(ctx.pidfile)) != 0) {
1924 if (pid == -1)
1925 logerr("%s: pidfile_lock", __func__);
1926 else
1927 logerrx(PACKAGE
1928 " already running on pid %d (%s)",
1929 pid, ctx.pidfile);
1930 goto exit_failure;
1931 }
1932 }
1933
1934 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_MASTER) {
1935 if (control_start(&ctx, NULL) == -1)
1936 logerr("%s: control_start", __func__);
1937 }
1938#else
1939 if (control_start(&ctx,
1940 ctx.options & DHCPCD_MASTER ? NULL : argv[optind]) == -1)
1941 {
1942 logerr("%s: control_start", __func__);
1943 goto exit_failure;
1944 }
1945#endif
1946
1947 logdebugx(PACKAGE "-" VERSION " starting");
1948 ctx.options |= DHCPCD_STARTED;
1949
1950#ifdef HAVE_SETPROCTITLE
1951 setproctitle("%s%s%s",
1952 ctx.options & DHCPCD_MASTER ? "[master]" : argv[optind],
1953 ctx.options & DHCPCD_IPV4 ? " [ip4]" : "",
1954 ctx.options & DHCPCD_IPV6 ? " [ip6]" : "");
1955#endif
1956
1957 if (if_opensockets(&ctx) == -1) {
1958 logerr("%s: if_opensockets", __func__);
1959 goto exit_failure;
1960 }
1961
1962 /* When running dhcpcd against a single interface, we need to retain
1963 * the old behaviour of waiting for an IP address */
1964 if (ctx.ifc == 1 && !(ctx.options & DHCPCD_BACKGROUND))
1965 ctx.options |= DHCPCD_WAITIP;
1966
1967 /* Start handling kernel messages for interfaces, addresses and
1968 * routes. */
1969 eloop_event_add(ctx.eloop, ctx.link_fd, dhcpcd_handlelink, &ctx);
1970
1971 /* Start any dev listening plugin which may want to
1972 * change the interface name provided by the kernel */
1973 if ((ctx.options & (DHCPCD_MASTER | DHCPCD_DEV)) ==
1974 (DHCPCD_MASTER | DHCPCD_DEV))
1975 dev_start(&ctx);
1976
1977 ctx.ifaces = if_discover(&ctx, &ifaddrs, ctx.ifc, ctx.ifv);
1978 if (ctx.ifaces == NULL) {
1979 logerr("%s: if_discover", __func__);
1980 goto exit_failure;
1981 }
1982 for (i = 0; i < ctx.ifc; i++) {
1983 if ((ifp = if_find(ctx.ifaces, ctx.ifv[i])) == NULL ||
1984 !ifp->active)
1985 logerrx("%s: interface not found or invalid",
1986 ctx.ifv[i]);
1987 }
1988 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx.ifaces, next) {
1989 if (ifp->active == IF_ACTIVE_USER)
1990 break;
1991 }
1992 if (ifp == NULL) {
1993 if (ctx.ifc == 0) {
1994 logfunc_t *logfunc;
1995
1996 logfunc = ctx.options & DHCPCD_INACTIVE ?
1997 logdebugx : logerrx;
1998 logfunc("no valid interfaces found");
1999 } else
2000 goto exit_failure;
2001 if (!(ctx.options & DHCPCD_LINK)) {
2002 logerrx("aborting as link detection is disabled");
2003 goto exit_failure;
2004 }
2005 }
2006
2007 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx.ifaces, next) {
2008 if (ifp->active)
2009 dhcpcd_initstate1(ifp, argc, argv, 0);
2010 }
2011 if_learnaddrs(&ctx, ctx.ifaces, &ifaddrs);
2012
2013 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_BACKGROUND && dhcpcd_daemonise(&ctx))
2014 goto exit_success;
2015
2016 opt = 0;
2017 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx.ifaces, next) {
2018 if (ifp->active) {
2019 run_preinit(ifp);
2020 if (!(ifp->options->options & DHCPCD_LINK) ||
2021 ifp->carrier != LINK_DOWN)
2022 opt = 1;
2023 }
2024 }
2025
2026 if (!(ctx.options & DHCPCD_BACKGROUND)) {
2027 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_MASTER)
2028 t = ifo->timeout;
2029 else {
2030 t = 0;
2031 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx.ifaces, next) {
2032 if (ifp->active) {
2033 t = ifp->options->timeout;
2034 break;
2035 }
2036 }
2037 }
2038 if (opt == 0 &&
2039 ctx.options & DHCPCD_LINK &&
2040 !(ctx.options & DHCPCD_WAITIP))
2041 {
2042 logfunc_t *logfunc;
2043
2044 logfunc = ctx.options & DHCPCD_INACTIVE ?
2045 logdebugx : logwarnx;
2046 logfunc("no interfaces have a carrier");
2047 if (dhcpcd_daemonise(&ctx))
2048 goto exit_success;
2049 } else if (t > 0 &&
2050 /* Test mode removes the daemonise bit, so check for both */
2051 ctx.options & (DHCPCD_DAEMONISE | DHCPCD_TEST))
2052 {
2053 eloop_timeout_add_sec(ctx.eloop, t,
2054 handle_exit_timeout, &ctx);
2055 }
2056 }
2057 free_options(&ctx, ifo);
2058 ifo = NULL;
2059
2060 if_sortinterfaces(&ctx);
2061 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp, ctx.ifaces, next) {
2062 if (ifp->active)
2063 eloop_timeout_add_sec(ctx.eloop, 0,
2064 dhcpcd_prestartinterface, ifp);
2065 }
2066
2067 i = eloop_start(ctx.eloop, &ctx.sigset);
2068 if (i < 0) {
2069 logerr("%s: eloop_start", __func__);
2070 goto exit_failure;
2071 }
2072 goto exit1;
2073
2074exit_success:
2075 i = EXIT_SUCCESS;
2076 goto exit1;
2077
2078exit_failure:
2079 i = EXIT_FAILURE;
2080
2081exit1:
2082 if (ifaddrs != NULL)
2083 freeifaddrs(ifaddrs);
2084 if (control_stop(&ctx) == -1)
2085 logerr("%s: control_stop", __func__);
2086 /* Free memory and close fd's */
2087 if (ctx.ifaces) {
2088 while ((ifp = TAILQ_FIRST(ctx.ifaces))) {
2089 TAILQ_REMOVE(ctx.ifaces, ifp, next);
2090 if_free(ifp);
2091 }
2092 free(ctx.ifaces);
2093 }
2094 free_options(&ctx, ifo);
2095 rt_dispose(&ctx);
2096 free(ctx.duid);
2097 if (ctx.link_fd != -1) {
2098 eloop_event_delete(ctx.eloop, ctx.link_fd);
2099 close(ctx.link_fd);
2100 }
2101 if_closesockets(&ctx);
2102 free_globals(&ctx);
2103#ifdef INET6
2104 ipv6_ctxfree(&ctx);
2105#endif
2106 dev_stop(&ctx);
2107 eloop_free(ctx.eloop);
2108
2109 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_STARTED && !(ctx.options & DHCPCD_FORKED))
2110 loginfox(PACKAGE " exited");
2111 logclose();
2112 free(ctx.logfile);
2113#ifdef USE_SIGNALS
2114 if (ctx.options & DHCPCD_FORKED)
2115 _exit(i); /* so atexit won't remove our pidfile */
2116#endif
2117 return i;
2118}
2119
